title: Documentation navigation
body: Implement a link to the next/previous markdown file at the bottom of the page. If possible with the title of the next file displayed. Example image: The next/previous Links should step through the order of the markdown files in a given folder. The first file in a folder only shows the "next-link", the last file only the "previous-link"

title: Autoupdates for docs
body: Documentation renderings should automatically update when the source files changes. Implement via EventSource.

title: Full text search for documentation
body: Implement a basic full text search for documentation files, takes cues from docsify.

title: Custom pattern path
body: Right now patternplate forces me to have patterns subdirectory as my root directory but I'm trying to use patternplate with an already existing project where changing the structure would be hard, maybe I missed something an there is a way to indicate to patternplate to use other directory as root directory.

title: Proposal: Transit map style dependency tree
body:
@marionebl had the idea to give the dependency tree view an update and move the style more towards urban transit maps.

So I researched some famous transit maps and found a very elegant timeless design and its [specification from the London underground](https://tfl.gov.uk/cdn/static/cms/documents/tfl-line-diagram-standard.pdf).

The process requires some concept work on how dependencies become linked and wich scope will be visible to the user initially per pattern.

Here is a first sketch inspired by the london transport map:
![pattern-tree-transit01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1252204/24475506/5c5d1f86-14d0-11e7-9ee5-94e777fef68a.png)

Legend:
- Large headlines ('Station names') are links to the dependencies of each pattern
- The inverted one is the current pattern (e.g. on a pattern detail page)
- The lines show the flow of dependencies relative to the current pattern
- The grey framed names below some stations are links to other patterns including the stations pattern ('Login Form' uses 'Labeled Input')

What do you think? Please add a comment below and vote/downvote this post :)

title: Favicon missing in patternplate 1.3.0
body:
There's no favicon showing, either running patternplate locally or on our server.

A coworker looked into this and found that in the older patternplate versions (0.17.x) the header looked like this.

```html
<head>
<title>erg-patternplate</title>
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0, user-scalable=no">
<link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="/static/images/patternplate-favicon-32.png" sizes="32x32" />
<link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="/static/images/patternplate-favicon-16.png" sizes="16x16" />
<link rel="stylesheet" href="/style/light.css" data-application-theme="data-application-theme">
</head>
```

Now the header looks like this
```html
<!doctype html><html><head><title data-react-helmet="true">patternplate</title><meta data-react-helmet="true" name="description" content=""/><meta data-react-helmet="true" name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1"/><link data-react-helmet="true" rel="stylesheet" href="./style/light.css" data-style-id="light"/></head>
```

```
var/www/html/static/images # ls -la
total 68
drwxr-xr-x 2 root root 4096 Dec 19 11:12 .
drwxr-xr-x 4 root root 4096 Dec 19 11:12 ..
rw-rr- 1 root root 392 Dec 19 11:55 patternplate-favicon-16.png
rw-rr- 1 root root 720 Dec 19 11:55 patternplate-favicon-32.png
rw-rr- 1 root root 1150 Dec 19 11:55 patternplate-favicon.ico
rw-rr- 1 root root 720 Dec 19 11:55 patternplate-favicon.png
rw-rr- 1 root root 13730 Dec 19 11:55 patternplate-icons.svg
rw-rr- 1 root root 11500 Dec 19 11:55 patternplate-logo-animated-dark.svg
rw-rr- 1 root root 11451 Dec 19 11:55 patternplate-logo-animated-light.svg
rw-rr- 1 root root 344 Dec 19 11:55 patternplate-logo.svg
```
Thanks in advance for looking into it (:

title: Document ui configuration
body:
The ui configuration is rather sophisticated and bound to get more complex via e.g.: https://github.com/sinnerschrader/patternplate/issues/141. 

As a component library IDE intended to also be used by customers and non-techs patternplate has to allow easy control over the actual appearance of the chrome. We should document available options and their limitations to make it easier for

1. Developers seeking to change the current interface appearance
2. Interested parties evaluating the project for usage

title: Feature Request: Theming for PP-Client
body:
Some users may want to theme the patternplate as part of their brand guide. Therefore we could provide a way to make the patternplate colors configurable.

In short: Everything that currently is "blueish" could be any color. 

These colors could be configured in patternplate-client config.

**Pros**
* Better integration into customers brand guides

**Cons**
* patternplate is a software/platform to organize and work with patterns and may therefore keep its own brand identity (such as word, code editors or any other (programming) tool)
* Adding colors via config file seems a bit ugly, but adding a `cutom-ui.less` does too

I'd like to here some other thoughts on this topic. So please vote this post up or down if you agree/disagree with this proposal.

/cc @marionebl @KnisterPeter @LKuechler

title: Feature Request: Preserving structure for search results
body:
Proposal for preserving for preserving the navigation structure for search results.

*Current state:*
Typing into search field shows results sorted alphabetically

*Proposed behaviour:*
Typing into search field shows results grouped/marked in their folders. The folders may preserve their order according to configuration and the patterns inside become ordered alphabetically.
The style of the Folder grouping may vary from default menu styling.

I'd like to here some other thoughts on this topic. So please vote this post up or down if you agree/disagree with this proposal.

/cc @marionebl @KnisterPeter @LKuechler

title: Improve documentation and examples for patternplate-transform-resolve-includes
body:
The examples and documentation in the readme of [patternplate-transform-resolve-includes](https://github.com/sinnerschrader/patternplate-transform-resolve-includes) are not easily understandable.

A minimum requirement would be to explain how the resolution works.

title: Faulty rendering of opacity indicator background on FF
body:
Browser: Firefox
OS: Windows

![screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4248851/20763662/4cac6d60-b72b-11e6-84c6-15b5bd75e2bf.png)

title: Can't switch theme when pattern is selected
body:
**PatternPlate Version:** 1.0.10
**Tested in:** Chrome 54, Firefox 49, Safari 10

The theme switch is only possible on navigation root level, e.g. requesting the dark theme style: `http://localhost:1337/style/dark.css`.

After selecting an pattern (e.g. `http://localhost:1337/pattern/my-cool-pattern/`) and activating the theme switch, the wrong resource is requested: `http://localhost:1337/pattern/my-cool-pattern/style/dark.css`.

Also the following error is shown in console:

```shell
error:  Error unknown file: Cannot read property 'type' of null
```

title: patternlist does not show all tags
body:
The list of patterns (e.g. some atoms folder) does not display all tags attached to a pattern.

In the case below the tags should be 'reviewed', 'deprecated', 'documentation-needed' and 'demo-needs-update'.

![tags](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/327445/20348260/d909b682-ac04-11e6-8285-8347d2e1d1f0.png)

title: Add 'deprecated' enum value to pattern.json schemas flag attribute.
body:
Currently the flag attribute for the pattern.json schema consists of 'alpha', 'beta', 'rc' and 'stable'.
There should be a status for end of life of a pattern. A good candidate would be 'deprecated'.

http://json.schemastore.org/pattern

title: interface should work without js
body:
**Broken features when `js` is unavailable:**
* Rulers
* Theme switch
* Static interface are mostly absolute, thus not working on subpaths

title: feature request: absorb default patternplate configuration
body: rather than on `patternplate init` dumping default configurations, perhaps consider dumping _no configuration_.  then, allow people to _add_ configuration behind a flag (e.g. `--config my-config.json`) if desired

title: patternplate init server configuration does not match that on patternplate-ui
body:
`init` has different transforms than:

https://github.com/sinnerschrader/patternplate-ui/blob/master/configuration/patternplate-server/patterns.js

i'm betting that -ui's is more up to date, given its babel support

title: Search does not contain all expected results
body:
The search does not return all expected results.
Possible error cause could be:

Add the following patterns: `atoms/Headline` and `print/atoms/Headline`
Then search for `headline`

title: (WIP) feat: command for creating new patterns
body:
WIP for #100.
A new pattern with default files can be created with the command:
`npm run start create ID path=FOLDER`
This would create the pattern folder inside FOLDER with the name ID.

Maybe we should change out the matchers for modifiers to use something like [minimist](https://github.com/substack/minimist) or [meow](https://github.com/sindresorhus/meow).

Todos:
- [ ] User config files
- [ ] Modifiers for changes to pattern.json (see #100)

title: Get rid of boilerplate-server, join patternplate projects
body:
## Rationale

The current separation of patternplate into `patternplate-client` and `patternplate-server` does not serve any real purpose and introduces considerable overhead. Additionally the `boilerplate-server` dependency with its convention over configuration mechanisms introduces complexity and yields less benefits than expected. 
## ToDo
- [ ] Remove dependency on `boilerplate-server` from `patternplate-client`
- [ ] Remove dependency on `boilerplate-server` from `patternplate-server`
- [ ] Remove dependency on `boilerplate-server` from `patternplate`
- [ ] Move `patternplate-client` to `patternplate` repository 
- [ ] Move `patternplate-server` to `patternplate` repository
- [ ] Add notices about the move on the `patternplate-{client,server}` repositories
- [ ] Discontinue the `patternplate-{client,server}` packages
- [ ] Deprecate `boilerplate-server`, add discontinuation notice to repository

title: Visualize CSS breakpoints in patternplate demo interface
body:
Media queries and responsive design remains a big source of misunderstanding between client, creatives and development teams. In order to help with communication about this topic, patternplate should provide means to visualize and document breakpoints for pattern demos. 

**Goals**
- [ ] Provide means to extract information about applicable breakpoints from CSS used for the current pattern demo
- [ ] Show applicable breakpoints (a.k.a: upper and lower media query bounds) as guides on the resize rulers already available in patternplate client. Both `*-width` and `*-height` breakpoints should be analyzed
- [ ] Clicking on breakpoint guides should resize the demo to the appropriate dimensions

**Non-Goals**
- Writing access to CSS via the patternplate UI is no goal of this feature

title: Implement a scaffolding utility for patterns
body:
## Rationale

When implementing a patternplate project from scratch there is a lot of work for developers involving creating folders, `pattern.json` files, adding pattern dependencies, etc. We should ease this tedious work by providing a scaffolding cli that helps with these tasks.
## Features

Features to implement for version 1.0:
- [ ]  **create** `<id>` - Scaffold a new pattern at `<id>`. Formats and files to create should be configurable via flags. Pass optional data to use for `pattern.json` via `--manifest.<keyPath>=<keyValue>`
## Non-Features

Not needed for version 1.0:
- [ ] **search** `<query>` - Search for `query` in the current pattern tree. Show pattern dependencies (possibly behind flag?)
- [ ]  **add** `<id>` `<localName>:<id>|<localName>:<id>[]` - Add one or a list of dependencies to `<id>`
- [ ] **remove** `<id>` `<localName>|<id>|(<localName>|<id>)[]` - Remove one or a list of dependencies from `<id>`'s `pattern.json`
- [ ] **move** `<id>` `<new-id>` - Move pattern at `<id>` to `<new-id>` and update all references to `<id>` in the pattern tree. Tell the user about the references.

title: Updated pattern links
Provide basic documentation already
body:
Provide proper documentation for patternplate. This should include:
- [x] Quick Start (Installation, Scaffolding, First start)
- [ ] Create basic overview page via gh-pages
  - [ ] Logo
  - [ ] Button
  - [ ] Headline (h1 - h3)
  - [ ] Image
  - [ ] Paragraph
  - [ ] Link
  - [ ] Text-Teaser
  - [ ] Imprint
- [ ] Pattern driven development; pattern.json, dependencies, formats
- [x] Default project scaffolding [patternplate init]
- [x] Creating your first pattern [Readme in Default project scaffold]

---
- [x] Create: In depth pattern create
- [ ] Show: patternplate ui usage / features
- [ ] Deliver: commonjs, bundles, custom

---
- Advanced: custom transforms, environments, ui configuration, build

---
- [x] Provide patternplate init helper

We could take a lot of cues from the fabricator documentation: http://fbrctr.github.io/advanced/customization.html
